programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. The programme reveals how essential surveillance cameras have become in the fight against crime and features footage of people caught red-handed
S02E07

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc:
A large convoy tries to escape Perth before sunset, and the future of Steve Grahame's trip hangs on a phone call to his mechanic
S02E02

programme.title: Trucking Hell
programme.desc:
Crouch incident manger Steve and his team have been called out to a lorry that has caught fire on the extremely busy A1. By the time Steve arrives, the fire has been put out and Callum has pulled the tractor unit onto a low loader
S06E03

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Officers go in pursuit of a driver who is so drunk that he can't even keep his car on the road and the chase ends with shocking results. Elsewhere, dog handler Tony encounters a naked man stranded at the side of the road, and Sophie is forced to buy a treat for the entire team due to a rookie mistake
S16E15

programme.title: Posse from Hell (1961)
programme.desc: Bandits invade a frontier town, rob the bank, kill the sheriff and kidnap a local woman. A tough gunslinger who was a friend of the dead lawman takes on the job of bringing them to justice, but the only one of the townspeople willing to help is a naive banker determined to prove his worth. Western, starring Audie Murphy, John Saxon, Vic Morrow and Lee Van Cleef

programme.title: Apache Drums (1951)
programme.desc: A gunslinging gambler is thrown out of an isolated frontier town for his improper behaviour. He returns to warn the unsuspecting settlers of an impending attack by a band of Apaches fighting to regain possession of their lost territory - but struggles to convince them of the danger. Western, starring Stephen McNally, Willard Parker, Coleen Gray and Arthur Shields

programme.title: Trucking Hell
programme.desc:

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc:
Driver Steve Grahame discovers his vehicle has taken a battering during the past three days, over which he has hauled 130 tons of goods across 2,000km
S02E03

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Rob and Spence respond to a reported knife attack, arriving to find the victim is on her way to hospital while the suspect is locked in a property and making threats against police. Negotiations take a turn when the slurring suspect topples out of an upstairs window, crashing to the patio below. Out on the roads, Lisa and Lewis assist Lenny with the arrest of a tricky trio who are suspected of stealing an elderly man's car
S19E04

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Officers Gav Hall and Dan Mottishaw are in hot pursuit of a suspected drug dealer, but the two-wheeled tearaway runs out of road, flips his bike over and crashes into a hedge. Elsewhere, a man wanted for ABH gives interceptors Lewis Marshall and Darren Chalk the runaround, and Jen Ellse pulls over a suspected uninsured driver, who struggles to explain the fake plates in his boot
S19E05

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Following police on a manhunt for a dangerous suspect, as dog-handler Jen and crime-fighting canine Quantum search in the dark for the assailant. A crackdown on cannabis cultivation leads police to £500,000 worth of Class B drugs farmed in a disused warehouse, and on the roads, a van with false plates causes complete carnage
S19E07

programme.title: Trucking Heavy
programme.desc:
Dave hauls a 68-tonne transformer through the back roads of Suffolk, avoiding weaker bridges and tackling narrow countryside roads. Smurf faces delays during a time-sensitive job
S02E07

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc:
Graham's race through the desert takes a sudden turn, while it is hard rock and hard knocks on an urgent run to the races for young trucker Will
S04E02

programme.title: WWE: Raw Highlights
programme.desc:
Wrestling action with the superstars of WWE, including Drew McIntyre, AJ Styles, Becky Lynch, Randy Orton and Seth Rollins. Presented by Tom Phillips, Samoa Joe and Byron Saxton
S01E172

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc:
Yorkshire police forces tackling an ever-more sophisticated criminal fraternity from the cities to the Dales. Police from the north and west of the historic county crack down on drug-addled drivers, and it is North Yorkshire's Roads Policing Group that faces the toughest challenge when a convicted drug dealer leads officers on a 140mph chase on one of the UK's busiest motorways. Jamie Theakston narrates
S01E01

programme.title: Trucking Heavy
programme.desc:
Steve Moss delivers a 60-ton reel of electrical cable for an ambitious green energy scheme, only for the convoy to be brought to a halt by a single swan
S01E03

programme.title: Beware
programme.desc:

programme.desc:

programme.title: Westbound (1959)
programme.desc: A former Union soldier is employed by a stagecoach company to guard a large gold shipment being transported across the country. Meanwhile, a loyal follower of the defeated Confederacy is plotting to steal the bullion to revive the cause, but his plans are confounded by traitorous henchmen and his wife, who was once the lover of the Union veteran. Western, with Randolph Scott, Andrew Duggan and Virginia Mayo

programme.title: War of the Wildcats (1943)
programme.desc: An ambitious cowboy engages in a bitter personal feud with a powerful oil baron in a battle for the rights to drill on sacred native American land, and when both men fall for the same woman, the conflict between them gets even uglier. Western adventure, starring John Wayne, Albert Dekker, Martha Scott and Gabby Hayes

programme.title: Trucking Hell
programme.desc:

S06E05

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc:
Turbo embarks on a journey through an area affected by bush fires, and Yogi faces the biggest week of his career
S02E04

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
The documentary follows Nottinghamshire officers in an operation to stop a van that intel suggests is packed with cocaine, and after detaining two suspects and seizing the van the team gets the green light to take the vehicle apart to find any hidden drugs. Behind the wheel of an unmarked car, Dan activates stealth mode as he tracks down a thief fresh from the scene of a house burglary and using a stolen Mercedes as a getaway car
S19E09

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Officers from the knife crime team give chase when a handcuffed suspect makes a break for it, but with his hands behind his back he soon face-plants into the tarmac. Meanwhile, stakes are high as the interceptors comb the streets for a man who has threatened to stab his former partner and harm her horse
S19E11

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Officers pursue a vehicle with obscured number plates and it charges off the wrong way down the A46, while Dan and Jules stop a disqualified driver who is in a unique disguise. Police also respond to a report of an alleged carjacking at knife point, and there are tears before bedtime for a car of teenagers
S22E01

programme.title: Inside
programme.desc:
Banged Up: HMP Wormwood Scrubs: The history of the famous prison, which has been used to incarcerate everyone from serial killers Ian Brady and Peter Sutcliffe to rock stars Pete Doherty and Keith Richards. The programme examines its use by MI5 in the Second World War, the story of a Soviet spy who escaped, and perhaps the most well-known inmate, the infamous Charles Bronson
S02E02

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
Exploring how some young people who commit crimes on the street take their first steps into a life of lawlessness, from terrorising communities to involvement with criminal gangs
S06E05

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
A stick of dynamite causes chaos for Duggie when it is brought into Carlisle's main police station and the armed response unit is called out after there is a report of a gun being spotted in a city centre bar. Duncan receives a shock when a cyclist who has been trapped under a car turns out to be someone he knows, officers haul in a driver who is well over the limit and Hayley comes to the rescue when a teenager's car hits a wall during a late-night drive. Documentary following the work of Cumbria's Roads Policing Unit
S05E02

programme.title: Fights, Camera, Action!
programme.desc:
Hell on Wheels: Clip show of dramatic confrontations filmed by eye-witnesses, presented by George Lamb. This episode looks at rage on two wheels - hostile and aggressive encounters between bicyclists or motorcyclists and cars, pedestrians, thieves, and of course other bikers
S01E01

programme.title: Trucking Heavy
programme.desc:
To haul a 190-ton reel of steel crane cable, driver Zack steers his 144-wheeled, 60-ton trailer from Warwickshire to Worksop to first load and then take it to Immingham docks
S01E04

programme.title: Beware
programme.desc:

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Dog handler Duncan and the firearms team find themselves in a tense stand-off with suspected drug dealers who could be armed, with German shepherd Tia sent in to search and discovering more than the unit bargained for. Steve has to deal with two teens, one who has crashed a stolen car, and the other who has been involved in a bar brawl, while Kev is poised to take out a car with a stinger

programme.title: Police Interceptors

Second World War drama, starring Robert Mitchum, Peter Falk, Arthur Kennedy, Robert Ryan and Earl Holliman

programme.desc:
999: Criminals Caught On Camera: Journalist Nick Wallis reveals how police use CCTV in the war against knife crime. In Exeter, a woman comes home to find her boyfriend has been stabbed several times. Meanwhile, in St Helens a camera operator spots an agitated man brandishing a blade and must give a running commentary until armed police arrive

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
999: Criminals: Caught on Camera: Documentary in which journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. Here he exposes the rise in ram raids across the UK, with footage of two masked men using a 4x4 to pull the front off a cash machine at the University of East Anglia in Norwich. Nick also shows how detectives used laser-scanning technology to recreate a crime scene and close in on a gang that terrorised West Yorkshire pub owners in 2013

programme.desc:
HMP Wormwood Scrubs: Evil Behind Bars: The history of the famous prison, which has been used to incarcerate everyone from serial killers Ian Brady and Peter Sutcliffe to rock stars Pete Doherty and Keith Richards. programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: 18/05/2023: Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present a round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc:
Angela Rippon, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville report on the woman whose credit rating was ruined after scammers took out multiple mobile phone contracts in her name. She only found out when she tried to apply for a mortgage
S15E04

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc:
How a young couple's new glamping business was threatened when their Instagram account was hacked into and taken over. The hacker demanded $500 to hand back control - but they stood their ground. Incidents like this are increasingly common, with more than half of small businesses suffering a cyberattack in the last 12 months. Rav Wilding looks at the work being done by West Midlands Cybercrime Unit to combat the problem
S03E04

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc:
Investigators search for a roofer who conned people out of more than half a million pounds, and a fraudster who lied to get a job as a Captain with one of the UK's largest airlines
S05E04

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc:
Martin Roberts and Martel Maxwell tour a Cornish period house with several old cars hidden in the overgrown back garden. Properties in Co Durham and south Wales about to be sold are also assessed
S26E24

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc:
Newbury 25: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents from Newbury Antiques and Collectors Fair in Berkshire, where experts Charles Hanson and David Harper help two teams acquire items of value to take to auction. The host also pops across to Bristol to meet the maker of cigar box guitars
S54E28

programme.title: BBC News at One
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc:
Crash and Burn: Rob cooks up a storm, while Zara gets to grips with her new role. Bear meets an old college friend with big ambitions
S24E66

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc:
Sarah Moore explores Beaconsfield recycling centre in Buckinghamshire, determined to save quality items from being crushed. There's a sliding door sideboard for furniture painter Chloe Kempster and a collection of wooden skis for lighting designer Duncan McKean. Sarah herself gets crafty with a collection of knitted blankets and patches. Narrated by Arthur Smith
S14E03

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc:
Kent: Nicki Chapman returns to her Kent roots to help a young family currently in London find a new home. Away from the house hunt, Nicki takes a trip down memory lane, meeting up with her best friend from school, before they join Nicki's mother at the family's beach hut in Herne Bay
S22E37

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc:
Nigel Havers presents the programme in which five dealers bid against one another to buy intriguing items brought in by members of the public, including a toy cafeteria truck, a surprising key, and Victorian Children's clogs
S04E01

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
A painting depicting the Lebanese city of Beirut arrives at the barn. It was painted by Nonny Jackson-Twist's grandfather just after the Second World War. He would very much like to hang the painting in his home, but it's faded, the canvas cracked and in some sections the paint is flaking away. However, fine art conservator Lucia Scalisi is only too happy to take on this monumental task. Also being restored are pair of silver Shabbat candlesticks and a dilapidated car jack. Presented by Jay Blades
S09E09

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc:
Alexander Armstrong hosts the quiz in which contestants try to record the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Former Coronation Street Sally Lindsay reveals the correct answers and comments on the players' scores
S28E09

programme.title: BBC News at Six
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Live chat and topical reports, presented by Alex Jones and Roman Kemp

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Jay breaks Lola out of hospital for a fun-filled day at the seaside but it quickly goes south as the pair get in trouble with the police after Lola steals a necklace to give to Lexi for her 16th birthday

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc:
The second group of seven hopefuls compete for the chance to work in a professional kitchen for the first time. They must cook a dish they would have on the menu of their own restaurant or pop-up, or feature in their cookbook. With Gregg unwell, Monica Galetti joins John Torode to decide which two will be going home, after which the remaining five work in the Royal Opera House's Piazza restaurant, under the guidance of executive chef Richard Robinson. But only the best will make it through to the semi-final
S19E17

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc:
The semi-finalists have their social media skills tested as they are challenged to sell a local street food brand online, under the watchful eye of TikTok sensation Uncle Roger. Next, Gordon tasks the contestants to devise a recipe to appear on the front page of Waitrose's in-house magazine, before presenting their creations in front of undercover experts including world-renowned food photographer, Mary McCartney. Who will impress Gordon and make it to the final?
S02E07

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in Fort William, Inverness-shire, to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: BBC journalists including Adam Fleming and Chris Mason host a weekly round-up from Westminster, delivering the usual mix of serious analysis and light-hearted gossip about the biggest stories in politics

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: 19/05/2023: Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present a round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc:
Gloria Hunniford, Julia Somerville and Angela Rippon investigate the case of a family whose once-loved home is now a wrecked shell, after an insurance claim made six years ago went disastrously wrong. Plus, the programme revisits a pledge made in 2018 by then-local government minister Rishi Sunak to keep private parking companies in check
S15E05

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc:
An incident in which a train driver suffered facial injuries after a brick was hurled at his cab, shattering the window. The train was travelling at 70mph, but the driver managed to bring it safely to a standstill, despite his injuries. Rav Wilding reports on how attacks like this have prompted one train company to start installing on-board technology, aimed at making journeys safer for passengers and staff
S03E05

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc:
Officers work to bring a bogus coach company to justice after leaving hundreds of pensions stranded in Torquay, and also track down a loan shark targeting hard-up families
S05E05

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc:
Dion Dublin looks round a chalet-style bungalow in the Derbyshire village of Kilburn and a three-bedroom end terrace in Huthwaite, Nottinghamshire that offers a colourful reminder of his footballing past. Plus, a revisit to a church in Dover that Martin Roberts first saw five years ago

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
A painting depicting the Lebanese city of Beirut arrives at the barn. It was painted by Nonny Jackson-Twist's grandfather just after the Second World War. He would very much like to hang the painting in his home, but it's faded, the canvas cracked and in some sections the paint is flaking away. However, fine art conservator Lucia Scalisi is only too happy to take on this monumental task. Also being restored are pair of silver Shabbat candlesticks and a dilapidated car jack. Presented by Jay Blades

There they are tasked to create a Scottish-limited edition of their products to launch in front of a home crowd. They then face the most dramatic grilling of their lives, as each tries to convince Gordon to back them with a £150,000 investment

programme.title: Rip Off Britain

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc:
An incident in which a train driver suffered facial injuries after a brick was hurled at his cab, shattering the window. The train was travelling at 70mph, but the driver managed to bring it safely to a standstill, despite his injuries. Rav Wilding reports on how attacks like this have prompted one train company to start installing on-board technology, aimed at making journeys safer for passengers and staff
S03E05

programme.title: Defenders UK

programme.title: Matt Willis: Fighting Addiction
programme.desc: Bassist and co-founder of Busted Matt Willis opens up about his experiences battling drug and alcohol addiction and his daily struggle to stay clean and sober. He speaks on the constant fear of relapse and the pressure it puts on himself and his family. Matt looks back on his past and his darkest days, trying to get to the root of his addictions. He visits a rehab unit that made a real difference to his recovery to speak with experts about why he and fellow addicts become dependent on drugs and alcohol before travelling to Imperial College London to meet a research team who are studying the differences in the brains of people with addictions and people without

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc:
The five hopefuls are tasked to create a dish with ingredients that on paper shouldn't work, but that becomes an unlikely tasty treat. They then head off to the Francis Crick Institute in central London, Europe's largest biomedical laboratory, which aims to gain further understand into how living things work, and carries out ground-breaking research with the aim of helping to treat, diagnose and prevent human disease, where under the acclaimed chef Jozef Youssef, they cook a five-course celebratory lunch, recreating one of Josef's technically demanding recipes

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc:
After several gruelling challenges, Gordon knows that all his finalists have what it takes to partner up with him. It's now time to drill down on their businesses and find out whose product is worthy of his endorsement. Gordon invites the final three contenders to Ibrox Stadium in Glasgow, a place that saw him forced to end his football career with Rangers and turn his hand to food. There they are tasked to create a Scottish-limited edition of their products to launch in front of a home crowd. They then face the most dramatic grilling of their lives, as each tries to convince Gordon to back them with a £150,000 investment

Rav Wilding looks at the work being done by West Midlands Cybercrime Unit to combat the problem

programme.desc:
A painting depicting the Lebanese city of Beirut arrives at the barn. It was painted by Nonny Jackson-Twist's grandfather just after the Second World War. He would very much like to hang the painting in his home, but it's faded, the canvas cracked and in some sections the paint is flaking away. However, fine art conservator Lucia Scalisi is only too happy to take on this monumental task. Also being restored are pair of silver Shabbat candlesticks and a dilapidated car jack. He visits a rehab unit that made a real difference to his recovery to speak with experts about why he and fellow addicts become dependent on drugs and alcohol before travelling to Imperial College London to meet a research team who are studying the differences in the brains of people with addictions and people without

Plus, efforts are made to catch a trader selling chocolate bars with a fake list of ingredients, putting children's health at risk

One is destined for the rental market, one as a holiday home and the other as their home. Jacqui Joseph and Dion Dublin assess their potential in realising their owners' ambitions

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc:
The five hopefuls are tasked to create a dish with ingredients that on paper shouldn't work, but that becomes an unlikely tasty treat. They then head off to the Francis Crick Institute in central London, Europe's largest biomedical laboratory, which aims to gain further understand into how living things work, and carries out ground-breaking research with the aim of helping to treat, diagnose and prevent human disease, where under the acclaimed chef Jozef Youssef, they cook a five-course celebratory lunch, recreating one of Josef's technically demanding recipes

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc:
After several gruelling challenges, Gordon knows that all his finalists have what it takes to partner up with him. It's now time to drill down on their businesses and find out whose product is worthy of his endorsement. Gordon invites the final three contenders to Ibrox Stadium in Glasgow, a place that saw him forced to end his football career with Rangers and turn his hand to food. There they are tasked to create a Scottish-limited edition of their products to launch in front of a home crowd. They then face the most dramatic grilling of their lives, as each tries to convince Gordon to back them with a £150,000 investment

A painting depicting the Lebanese city of Beirut arrives at the barn. It was painted by Nonny Jackson-Twist's grandfather just after the Second World War. Adam Henson looks into the dangers facing sheep and lambs from an increase in dog attacks this year, and Charlotte Smith investigates fears a 40-year-old chemical dump is threatening a village in Wales. Plus, a new regular strand following four young farmers from around the country

Plus, Runjeet Singh explores newly discovered photographic archive revealing the story of Sikh worship in this corner of Kent

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest news from the BBC.

programme.title: Our World
programme.desc: Once dubbed the 'murder capital' of the world, for nearly three decades, rival gangs ruled the streets of El Salvador through a regime of violence, extortion and fear. That is, until now. For the last year, the country's young, media-savvy president has launched a full-scale war on gangs, imposing emergency constitutional measures and giving police sweeping new powers of arrest. As the State of Exception passes its one-year anniversary, more than 65,000 people have been arrested and dramatic images of a new 'mega prison' hit headlines around the world. But as the country transforms before people's eyes, this newfound freedom hides a dark reality. The government is accused of locking up thousands of innocent people without trial and in flagrant abuse of their human rights. Will Grant meets families impacted by both sides of this controversial policy to uncover the hidden cost of peace on the streets.

programme.title: Our World
programme.desc: Once dubbed the 'murder capital' of the world, for nearly three decades, rival gangs ruled the streets of El Salvador through a regime of violence, extortion and fear. That is, until now. For the last year, the country's young, media-savvy president has launched a full-scale war on gangs, imposing emergency constitutional measures and giving police sweeping new powers of arrest. As the State of Exception passes its one-year anniversary, more than 65,000 people have been arrested and dramatic images of a new 'mega prison' hit headlines around the world. But as the country transforms before people's eyes, this newfound freedom hides a dark reality. The government is accused of locking up thousands of innocent people without trial and in flagrant abuse of their human rights. Will Grant meets families impacted by both sides of this controversial policy to uncover the hidden cost of peace on the streets.

programme.title: Amol Rajan Interviews
programme.desc: In a revealing interview about Piers Morgan's rollercoaster career and personal life, Amol Rajan explores everything from hacking allegations to the divisive media figure's belief in God. From sackings to superstardom, from being punched by Jeremy Clarkson to his role in the culture wars, Morgan reveals the emotional and physical scars he has picked up over the decades.

programme.title: BBC News

programme.title: Our World
programme.desc: Once dubbed the 'murder capital' of the world, for nearly three decades, rival gangs ruled the streets of El Salvador through a regime of violence, extortion and fear. That is, until now. For the last year, the country's young, media-savvy president has launched a full-scale war on gangs, imposing emergency constitutional measures and giving police sweeping new powers of arrest. As the State of Exception passes its one-year anniversary, more than 65,000 people have been arrested and dramatic images of a new 'mega prison' hit headlines around the world. But as the country transforms before people's eyes, this newfound freedom hides a dark reality. The government is accused of locking up thousands of innocent people without trial and in flagrant abuse of their human rights. Will Grant meets families impacted by both sides of this controversial policy to uncover the hidden cost of peace on the streets.

programme.title: Our World
programme.desc: Once dubbed the 'murder capital' of the world, for nearly three decades, rival gangs ruled the streets of El Salvador through a regime of violence, extortion and fear. That is, until now. For the last year, the country's young, media-savvy president has launched a full-scale war on gangs, imposing emergency constitutional measures and giving police sweeping new powers of arrest. As the State of Exception passes its one-year anniversary, more than 65,000 people have been arrested and dramatic images of a new 'mega prison' hit headlines around the world. But as the country transforms before people's eyes, this newfound freedom hides a dark reality. The government is accused of locking up thousands of innocent people without trial and in flagrant abuse of their human rights. Will Grant meets families impacted by both sides of this controversial policy to uncover the hidden cost of peace on the streets.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: HARDtalk
programme.desc:
In-depth interviews with the world's leading politicians, opinion-formers and key figures from culture, business and sport.
S2023E84

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: World Business Report
programme.desc: Financial news

programme.title: The Sky at Night
programme.desc: The team explores the threat of an asteroid impact on earth and meet space scientists who are developing methods of planetary defence that sound like the stuff of science fiction. Maggie meets Professor Alan Fitzsimmons, expert in asteroid observation, to learn how the latest technology monitors near-Earth asteroids. He explains which ones are a current concern, and why we missed the dangerous Chelyabinsk meteor - a 9,000-ton fireball that exploded in the sky above Russia

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc:
Capitalism and Commerce: Liz McIvor examines how the railways stimulated great changes to the nation's economy, and encouraged a new generation of mechanical engineers, skilled workers, managers and accountants. Originally, local entrepreneurs viewed trains as vehicles for shifting raw materials, stock and goods, however it soon became clear that there was money to be made in transporting people
S01E02

programme.title: A House Through Time
programme.desc:
David Olusoga traces the history of an 18th-century sea captain's house near Bristol's docks with links to the slave trade. Bristol was a major port in the transportation of slaves from Africa's Guinea Coast to the Caribbean, and both the man who built the house and its first full-time resident were heavily involved in the trade. David uncovers stories of piracy, abandoned babies, a household slave who made a daring escape from the property, and a protest on the doorstep as the abolitionist movement gained momentum
S03E01

programme.title: Tea with Mussolini (1999)
programme.desc: Eccentric English and American women living in Florence during the tense pre-war years of the 1930s experience the ups and downs of parenthood when they collectively adopt a local boy disowned by his father. However, as international hostilities break out, their happy existence comes under threat. Period comedy drama, starring Maggie Smith, Judi Dench, Joan Plowright, Cher, Lily Tomlin and Baird Wallace

programme.title: Summer Holiday (1963)
programme.desc: Four mechanics embark on a fun-filled trip across Europe on board a double-decker London bus, and enjoy all manner of romantic adventures with three young women who hitch a ride on their way to Athens. However, an unexpected stowaway causes a few surprises. Musical comedy, starring Cliff Richard, Lauri Peters, Melvyn Hayes, Una Stubbs, Ron Moody and the Shadows

programme.title: Mark Kermode's Secrets of Cinema
programme.desc:
Mark Kermode's Secrets of Cinema: Pop Music Movies: The critic examines techniques and conventions within a genre that mixes film and music and encompasses many forms, from drama and comedy to fantasy and documentary. There is the classic pop star vehicle, where the biggest acts play themselves, or a version of themselves, as well as dramatised accounts of the stars' lives that dazzle with musical set pieces, while playing on the fascination with the darker side of fame
S03E02

programme.title: Paul Merson: A Walk Through My Life
programme.desc: The football pundit and former Arsenal and England midfielder walks through North Yorkshire, reflecting on his life, career and faith. Carrying a 360-degree camera, he also describes his struggles with drink and gambling addiction

programme.title: A House Through Time
programme.desc:
David Olusoga traces the history of an 18th-century sea captain's house near Bristol's docks with links to the slave trade. Bristol was a major port in the transportation of slaves from Africa's Guinea Coast to the Caribbean, and both the man who built the house and its first full-time resident were heavily involved in the trade. David uncovers stories of piracy, abandoned babies, a household slave who made a daring escape from the property, and a protest on the doorstep as the abolitionist movement gained momentum
S03E01

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Bruno Brookes introduces studio performances from September 22, 1994, by Corona, Michelle Gayle, Suede, Naomi Campbell, Cyndi Lauper, Lisa Loeb and Nine Stories, and Whigfield, plus a video from Elton John and an appearance over satellite by Bon Jovi

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Claire Sturgess presents the edition first broadcast on September 29, 1994, featuring 2 Unlimited, the Cranberries, Pato Banton, Reel 2 Reel featuring the Mad Stuntman, the Kinks, Snap! featuring Summer, East 17, Shane MacGowan & the Popes, Whigfield and Gary Numan

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 19/05/1983: Simon Bates and Gary Davies present music from May 19 1983, featuring D Train, New Edition, David Grant, Blancmange, the Beat and Wham!

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 21/05/1987: Peter Powell and Simon Bates present the edition first broadcast on 21 May 1987, featuring performances by Cameo, Whitney Houston, Starship and Wet Wet Wet

programme.title: Queens of Song at the BBC
programme.desc: A selection of songs by some of the finest female artists, featuring performances by Whitney Houston, Beyoncé, Mariah Carey, Grace Jones, Cher, Aretha Franklin, Tina Turner, Diana Ross and Adele

programme.title: Viva La Diva: The Queens of Pop
programme.desc: Ana Matronic explores the key elements that have shaped the identities and sounds of Beyoncé, Cher, Grace Jones, Madonna and Mariah Carey, investigating the lives and legacies of these five pop superstars. The Scissor Sisters singer unpicks their triumphs and tragedies to get a better understanding of what makes them so special, before setting out what a diva might look like in the future

programme.title: Grace Jones: Bloodlight and Bami (2017)
programme.desc: Documentary profile of the singer, following her in the recording studio, backstage and at home with her extended family in Jamaica, interspersed with concert footage of hits including Pull Up to the Bumper and Slave to the Rhythm

programme.title: Queens of Song at the BBC
programme.desc: A selection of songs by some of the finest female artists, featuring performances by Whitney Houston, Beyoncé, Mariah Carey, Grace Jones, Cher, Aretha Franklin, Tina Turner, Diana Ross and Adele

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Bruno Brookes introduces studio performances from September 22, 1994, by Corona, Michelle Gayle, Suede, Naomi Campbell, Cyndi Lauper, Lisa Loeb and Nine Stories, and Whigfield, plus a video from Elton John and an appearance over satellite by Bon Jovi

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Claire Sturgess presents the edition first broadcast on September 29, 1994, featuring 2 Unlimited, the Cranberries, Pato Banton, Reel 2 Reel featuring the Mad Stuntman, the Kinks, Snap! featuring Summer, East 17, Shane MacGowan & the Popes, Whigfield and Gary Numan

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 19/05/1983: Simon Bates and Gary Davies present music from May 19 1983, featuring D Train, New Edition, David Grant, Blancmange, the Beat and Wham!

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 21/05/1987: Peter Powell and Simon Bates present the edition first broadcast on 21 May 1987, featuring performances by Cameo, Whitney Houston, Starship and Wet Wet Wet

programme.title: Himalaya with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
The Roof of the World: Following his adventures at Everest Base Camp, the intrepid traveller leaves the mountains behind and moves on to Tibet. Here he discovers that, while there may be an increasing Chinese influence, religion is once again being tolerated. He visits the Potala Palace, the spectacular monasteries of Tashilunpo and takes a dip in a hot spring. From there he continues his journey with a family of nomads heading to a summer horse festival in Yushu
S01E04

programme.title: Himalaya with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
Leaping Tigers, Naked Nagas: The adventurer travels along the Yangtze river into China, where he meets Mosuo singer Namu, who explains the region's traditional walking marriage ceremonies. He continues into India to marvel at one of Assam's great tea estates, makes the acquaintance of the local elephants and stays at a monastery where the monks introduce him to their unique dancing style
S01E05

programme.title: Afterglow
programme.desc:
Now Let's Dance!: Cheerful mother of three Ester is about to turn 40 and planning to celebrate the big birthday with all her friends and family. But the day before the party, she receives a phone call that turns her life upside down. Drama, starring Nina Ellen Odegaard. In Norwegian
S01E01

programme.title: Afterglow
programme.desc:
A Magical Evening: Ester insists on one last magical night out with her closest friends before the cancer treatment begins. But unbeknown to all of them, Charlotte makes an unsettling discovery. Drama, starring Nina Ellen Odegaard and Sara Khorami. In Norwegian
S01E02

programme.title: A Timewatch Guide
programme.desc:
The Mary Rose: A Timewatch Guide: Historian Dan Snow explores the discovery, excavation and raising of the ship, finding out what the latest research has revealed about the vessel and her crew. The presenter also investigates how the project helped create modern underwater archaeology, and examines the techniques, challenges and successes of the divers and archaeologists involved
S01E01

programme.title: Victoria Wood: The Secret List
programme.desc:
With a career spanning more than 40 years and crossing every possible genre, Victoria Wood amassed a back catalogue bulging with sublime comedy moments. The first of two documentaries offers a unique opportunity to see the very best bits of Victoria's work that she loved the most, drawing on some of the 20 sketches chosen by her in a notebook discovered after her death. Plus, contributors including Russell T Davies, Ken Loach, Winsome Pinnock, Jane Wymark and Joan Armatrading discuss Victoria's broad catalogue of award-winning comedy. Narrated by Sara Pascoe
S01E01

programme.title: Victoria Wood: The Secret List
programme.desc:
With a career spanning more than 40 years and crossing every possible genre, Victoria Wood amassed a back catalogue bulging with sublime comedy moments. This second of two programmes draws on further favourite sketches chosen by her in a notebook discovered after her death. Plus, contributors discuss her broad catalogue of award-winning comedy
S01E02

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc:
Misunderstandings: A chance encounter leads to an invitation for Jean to stay at her sister-in-law's home, but she has to persuade Lionel to accompany her. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer
S02E05

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc:
Moving On: Bob takes Terry on a tour of their old haunts - only to reveal most of them have been demolished. Terry finds it difficult accepting that times have changed during his time away - and a job interview proves the last straw. Classic comedy, with James Bolam and Rodney Bewes
S01E04

programme.title: Himalaya with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
The Roof of the World: Following his adventures at Everest Base Camp, the intrepid traveller leaves the mountains behind and moves on to Tibet. Here he discovers that, while there may be an increasing Chinese influence, religion is once again being tolerated. He visits the Potala Palace, the spectacular monasteries of Tashilunpo and takes a dip in a hot spring. From there he continues his journey with a family of nomads heading to a summer horse festival in Yushu
S01E04

programme.title: John Williams at the BBC
programme.desc: Performances featuring the guitarist, from a BBC archive spanning 50 years. The programme includes classical masterworks, the prog rock of Sky and comedy with Eric Sykes. There are also duets with fellow guitar maestro Julian Bream

programme.title: BBC Proms
programme.desc: The naturalist is joined by his stepdaughter and fellow wildlife presenter Megan McCubbin on stage at the Royal Albert Hall as Ben Palmer conducts the BBC Scottish Symphony Orchestra in music from BBC natural history documentaries. The concert is an audiovisual celebration of the corporation's world-famous Natural History Unit, from David Attenborough's pioneering early adventures through to Frozen Planet II, with images, natural sounds, spoken word sections and music by composers including Hans Zimmer and George Fenton

programme.title: Hans Zimmer: Hollywood Rebel
programme.desc: Profile of the Oscar-winning composer responsible for some of the best-loved film and TV scores of the past few decades. Contributors include directors Christopher Nolan, Denis Villeneuve, and Steve McQueen. In this portrait, Zimmer reveals the musical secrets of his craft - how he goes about terrifying, moving and raising people's spirits through his work

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Tracey Emin: Where Do You Draw the Line? - Imagine: Alan Yentob follows the artist over the course of 12 months to chart her creative process, talking about her life to date and how she sees the rest of her career. Tracey discusses her troubled early years in Margate and the series of breakthroughs in the 1990s that saw her become a leading light of the Young British Artists, featuring career-defining work like My Bed and her embroidered tent Everyone I Have Ever Slept With 1963-1995. Contributors include Nicholas Serota, Jay Jopling, Maria Balshaw and David Dawson

programme.title: Simon Schama Meets
programme.desc:
Simon Schama Meets Ai Weiwei: The presenter speaks to some of the world's most influential contemporary artists and activists. Ai Weiwei discusses his journey to being a voice for the downtrodden, and how his father was both a key figure in the Communist rise to power, only to fall foul of the state during the Cultural Revolution
S01E01

programme.title: Berlin 1945
programme.desc:
Life in the German capital in the year the Second World War ended, told through the stories of those who experienced it - from ordinary Germans to the Allied forces who entered the city. In the final episode, the British, French and Americans troop wait to enter Berlin, while members of the Jewish community, among whom there are few survivors, regroup
S01E03

programme.title: BBC Proms
programme.desc: The naturalist is joined by his stepdaughter and fellow wildlife presenter Megan McCubbin on stage at the Royal Albert Hall as Ben Palmer conducts the BBC Scottish Symphony Orchestra in music from BBC natural history documentaries. The concert is an audiovisual celebration of the corporation's world-famous Natural History Unit, from David Attenborough's pioneering early adventures through to Frozen Planet II, with images, natural sounds, spoken word sections and music by composers including Hans Zimmer and George Fenton

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc:
The Age of Leisure: Liz McIvor presents a documentary examining excursion trains, which became popular from the 1840s onwards, with tourists taking day trips and holidays, and seeing parts of the country they had never seen before. Some trains were set up to satisfy the demand to witness public executions, whereas others transported people to horse racing and sporting events. Working-class northerners had access to the Lake District, however Lakeland resident William Wordsworth was initially unhappy about the new visitors
S01E03

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Age of Steam
programme.desc:
Steam on the Water: The development of the steamship, from the earliest paddle boats and the first iron-hulled vessels to modern sport screw propellers and ships powered by steam turbines, such as the Royal Yacht Britannia
S01E05

programme.title: Italy's Invisible Cities
programme.desc:
Venice: Alexander Armstrong and Dr Michael Scott explore the Italian city of Venice, using 3D technology to discover how a city built in a swamp came to be one of the most powerful locations in Medieval Europe. The pair dive deep into the many canals in this unique place to experience how its buildings still remain standing to this day, and highlight how Venice's beauty once masked a ruthless secret state, and a world of excess and vice
S01E02

programme.title: Saving Venice
programme.desc: Documentary exploring how the Italian city is subject to constant environmental issues, which are becoming more commonplace due to the impact of climate change

programme.title: The Fifteen Billion Pound Railway
programme.desc:
Under Pressure, Over Budget - Part Two: The concluding episode follows the aftermath of the shock news that the Elizabeth Line has been delayed by over a year, and will cost hundreds of millions of pounds more than planned. As the drama unfolds, engineers, technicians and train staff pull together to work on borrowed time, and must learn to operate the new trains and test out the new twin tunnels under London before it can open to the public
S03E02

programme.title: Building Britain's Biggest Nuclear Power Station
programme.desc:
Part two of two. Following the challenges involved with building the Hinkley Point C in the remote Somerset countryside, the first new nuclear power station in Britain for a generation. This time, the team creates an extensive flood defence system to protect the site from a nuclear disaster like the one that befell the Fukushima Daiichi power plant in Japan. Elsewhere, cameras follow specialists as they work to uncover unexploded Second World War bombs that threaten the installation of the 4500-tonne cooling water intake heads
S01E02

programme.title: H2O: The Molecule That Made Us
programme.desc:
Crisis: Storm chasers and photographers track the global changes in storms and floods across America, while Nasa's Grace satellites reveal global overuse of aquifers
S01E03

programme.title: Novels That Shaped Our World
programme.desc:
The Class Ceiling: The documentary explores how novels through the ages have embraced the class struggle, from Dickens, Gaskell and Hardy through to Robert Tressell's The Ragged-Trousered Philanthropists and the group of working-class writers who began to write their own stories in post-war Britain. With readings by Russell Tovey, Darren Boyd, Alex Macqueen, Emily Berrington, Freddie Fox, Rian Gordon and Olivia Barrowclough
S01E03

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc:
The Age of Leisure: Liz McIvor presents a documentary examining excursion trains, which became popular from the 1840s onwards, with tourists taking day trips and holidays, and seeing parts of the country they had never seen before. Some trains were set up to satisfy the demand to witness public executions, whereas others transported people to horse racing and sporting events. Working-class northerners had access to the Lake District, however Lakeland resident William Wordsworth was initially unhappy about the new visitors
S01E03

programme.title: Himalaya with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
Leaping Tigers, Naked Nagas: The adventurer travels along the Yangtze river into China, where he meets Mosuo singer Namu, who explains the region's traditional walking marriage ceremonies. He continues into India to marvel at one of Assam's great tea estates, makes the acquaintance of the local elephants and stays at a monastery where the monks introduce him to their unique dancing style
S01E05

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc:
The New Commuters: Liz McIvor examines how the railways enabled people to live farther away from the places where they worked, visiting London and the south east of England, the nation's largest commuter zone
S01E04

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Age of Steam
programme.desc:
Steam and the Modern Age: An examination of the major advances made with the invention of the steam turbine, which is still used today to generate electricity in coal-fired and nuclear power stations. Fred also discovers how the country's steam heritage is preserved by museums and societies throughout the country
S01E06

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc:
The Cruise: Lionel asks Jean to accompany him on an all-expenses-paid cruise, but she remains unmoved by his efforts to woo her. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer
S02E06

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc:
I'll Never Forget Whatshername: Terry decides he would like to track down some of his former girlfriends - little suspecting the shocks that await him. James Bolam stars
S01E05

programme.title: Expedition Volcano
programme.desc:
Documentary following scientists studying some of the world's most dangerous active volcanos in the Democratic Republic of Congo. The first of two films explores Nyiragongo, which has erupted twice in the past 50 years, most recently in 2002, when it devastated the nearby city of Goma. However, it lies in a region troubled by war and humanitarian crises, which has made study of the volcano difficult. Former Royal Marine Aldo Kane is given the task of ensuring the team's safety
S01E01

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Animation film based on the voice notes that two Afghan women exchanged in the months that followed the Taliban's return to power in 2021. Raha chose to stay in Kabul, where she was confronted with the violence of the regime. Marwa left with her husband just in time and found herself in a refugee camp in Abu Dhabi, waiting to be welcomed into another country

programme.title: Escape from Kabul Airport
programme.desc: The inside story of the largest airlift in modern US history, which took place in August 2021 when America withdrew its troops from Afghanistan, marking the end of its longest war. The film combines never-before-seen on-the-ground archival footage from the evacuation, alongside interviews with evacuees, eyewitnesses, US Marines and Taliban fighters

programme.title: Britain and the Sea
programme.desc:
Trade & Romance: David Dimbleby investigates the importance of the sea to trade and to the individual livelihoods of coastal communities. He sails along the west coast of Scotland, starting at Craobh Haven and along the Crinan Canal, a waterway designed by East Lothian engineer John Rennie to take 120 miles off the journey from the west coast to Glasgow and safely avoid the turbulent waters around the Mull of Kintyre. He also climbs aboard the last working sea-going Clyde puffer, where he earns his keep shovelling coal in the steam room, and reflects on the role played by the river in both trade and shipbuilding
S01E03

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Documentary laying bare Chechnya's deadly war against its gay citizens, which reveals the bravery of those running rescue missions to protect the republic's LGBTQ community

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc:
The New Commuters: Liz McIvor examines how the railways enabled people to live farther away from the places where they worked, visiting London and the south east of England, the nation's largest commuter zone
S01E04

programme.title: The Fifteen Billion Pound Railway
programme.desc:
Under Pressure, Over Budget - Part Two: The concluding episode follows the aftermath of the shock news that the Elizabeth Line has been delayed by over a year, and will cost hundreds of millions of pounds more than planned. As the drama unfolds, engineers, technicians and train staff pull together to work on borrowed time, and must learn to operate the new trains and test out the new twin tunnels under London before it can open to the public
S03E02

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc:
Food and Shopping: Thanks to the advent of rail, moving produce around at speed suddenly became possible, allowing fresh meat, wet fish, dairy, fruit and vegetables to be widely available. With a new system of rapid transport it was now possible for London to enjoy food supplies from all corners of the nation. As Liz McIvor reveals, Victorian men and women developed a taste for one particular dish that would be popular with the masses for generations to come - fish and chips
S01E05

programme.title: Oak Tree: Nature's Greatest Survivor
programme.desc: George McGavin explores one of the great icons of the British countryside - the oak tree. Studying a 400-year-old tree throughout the different seasons of the year, George investigates its surprisingly sophisticated biology, how it adapts to its ever-changing environment and why it has become such an important part of the countryside

programme.title: Secrets of Size: Atoms to Supergalaxies
programme.desc:
Going Small: Part one of two. Jim Al-Khalili explores the universe at the smallest scales, from tiny atoms to vast galaxies. The first episode examines objects too small to glimpse with the naked eye, and reveals how nanomaterials such as graphene are revolutionising engineering, medicine, computing, electronics and environmental science
S01E01

programme.title: Lucky Sunil
programme.desc: Andrew Davies's satirical drama telling the story of Sunil, an Indian law student who travels to London in the hope of making it big. But he finds his new life is not quite as easy as he expected it to be, and descends into a world of hefty debts and dodgy deals among Britain's Asian emigres. Starring Kulvinder Ghir. Originally broadcast in 1988

programme.title: Andrew Davies: Rewriting the Classics
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the creative process of the screenwriter behind some of TV's most acclaimed adaptations of classic literature, from the 1995 version of Pride and Prejudice to the 2018 dramatisation of Victor Hugo's Les Miserables. He also discusses how to go about transforming sprawling, lengthy and detailed novels into primetime drama, turning one art form into another altogether different one. With contributions from authors Sarah Waters and Helen Fielding, actors Dominic West and Olivia Colman, and industry figures Jane Tranter and Sue Birtwhistle

programme.title: Oak Tree: Nature's Greatest Survivor
programme.desc: George McGavin explores one of the great icons of the British countryside - the oak tree. Studying a 400-year-old tree throughout the different seasons of the year, George investigates its surprisingly sophisticated biology, how it adapts to its ever-changing environment and why it has become such an important part of the countryside

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc:

With a new system of rapid transport it was now possible for London to enjoy food supplies from all corners of the nation. As Liz McIvor reveals, Victorian men and women developed a taste for one particular dish that would be popular with the masses for generations to come - fish and chips
S01E05

The first episode examines objects too small to glimpse with the naked eye, and reveals how nanomaterials such as graphene are revolutionising engineering, medicine, computing, electronics and environmental science
S01E01

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc:
A Touch of Class: Liz McIvor presents a documentary examining class divisions on trains, with separate carriages for first, second and third class passengers. Over time, trains acted as a catalyst, with people travelling to regions and places for the first time, as well as changing the nation's relationship with royalty and developing a stronger sense of shared identity and culture
S01E06

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Building of Britain
programme.desc:
Mighty Cathedrals: Fred uncovers the construction techniques of stonemasons and carpenters through the ages, focusing on Norman cathedrals. The former steeplejack admires Peterborough Cathedral and Rochester Castle, where he demonstrates how tactics used to invade the fortress centuries ago resemble today's demolition methods
S01E01

programme.title: A House Through Time
programme.desc:
David Olusoga traces the house's fortunes in the 18th and 19th centuries. He begins by investigating the death of owner Joseph Holbrook, and discovering why his daughter was written out of the will. A later resident of the home rises to become mayor in the 1830s, but had to find a way to prevent riots that had ravaged the city years earlier from occurring again. David also delves into the life of a servant who worked in the house in the 1870s, only to leave domestic servitude for an abusive marriage, and discovers how a successful teacher who later owned the house ended up committed to an asylum
S03E02

programme.title: This Cultural Life
programme.desc: Whoopi Goldberg talks to John Wilson about the influences that shaped her career, including her earliest experiences of acting with a children's community project in New York, and being encouraged by her mother to make the most of free cultural opportunities in the city

programme.title: The Color Purple (1985)
programme.desc: A much-abused black woman is separated from her children and her sister, and doomed to a life of virtual slavery at the hands of her brutish new husband on an impoverished farm in rural Georgia. Steven Spielberg's drama, based on Alice Walker's novel, starring Whoopi Goldberg, Danny Glover, Oprah Winfrey, Margaret Avery and Willard E Pugh

programme.title: Italy's Invisible Cities
programme.desc:
Venice: Alexander Armstrong and Dr Michael Scott explore the Italian city of Venice, using 3D technology to discover how a city built in a swamp came to be one of the most powerful locations in Medieval Europe. The pair dive deep into the many canals in this unique place to experience how its buildings still remain standing to this day, and highlight how Venice's beauty once masked a ruthless secret state, and a world of excess and vice
S01E02

Contributors include directors Christopher Nolan, Denis Villeneuve, and Steve McQueen. In this portrait, Zimmer reveals the musical secrets of his craft - how he goes about terrifying, moving and raising people's spirits through his work
